intro: Myrodendrum floribundum, commonly known as the sweet-scented myrtle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal or mountainous regions. Its leaves are glossy and emit a sweet, honey-like fragrance, especially when crushed. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
